trans-unit.target: Призовите своего боевого чокобо, выданного Великой компанией.<tab>Born and bred in the city<var 1F /var>state of Ishgard, the majority of company chocobos are geldings of the rouncey variety; however, massive destriers and miniature Belah'dian jennets are also raised to accommodate the builds of Roegadyn and Lalafellin riders respectively.<tab>Chocobos are stout- hearted creatures, but they have their limits. - Mimigun

Use the odd-shaped horn gifted to you by the wandering minstrel to call a massive goobbue to your side.<tab>Traded for a song by the High Satrap of a distant land, the secret to taming these creatures once thought to be unbreakable was introduced to Eorzea by a mysterious wandering minstrel who journeyed through the realm in the final days before the Calamity.<tab>Would that I had the girth of a goobbue! - Nanamo Ul Namo

Five years and a realm-shaking Calamity were not enough to break the bonds between you and your loyal steed. A single whistle and he will be at your side once again.<tab>In the five years following your sudden disappearance from the Carteneau Flats, your ever-faithful chocobo spent each waking moment galloping across the realm in search of his lost master. His myriad adventures are nothing less than fantastical and heartbreaking...but that is a story for another day.<tab>Go find the chocobo you rode in on, and ride on out. - Sevrin

Призовите в бой свой Магитех-механоид, модифицированный в «Шестерёнках Гарлонда».<tab>Этот разработанный гарлеанами Магитех-механоид класса «жнец» был очищен от оригинальных систем управления и заменен новым, модифицированным ядром, созданным Сидом из «Шестерёнок Гарлонда».<tab>Наконец-то наш собственный Магитех-механоид — Сид Гарлонд

Summon your fleet-footed battle coeurl, trained from a pup to recognize you as a friend...not food.<tab>Native to the jungles of the Near East, coeurls were only recently introduced to Eorzea, brought over from faraway lands such as Thavnair by Ul'dahn nobles who thought to breed them as pets. Now, but a handful of skilled tamers living in recluse on the Pearl are said to be able to train them.<tab>Hey, good lookin'! Catch my coeurl yet? - Swygrael

Summon forth a riding ahriman, bound to this realm with powerful magicks guaranteed to never fade.<tab>Though little is known of the void and the creatures which call the extra-dimensional realm home, scholars have discovered that there is a strict hierarchy amongst voidsent consisting of twelve distinct tiers. Ahrimans are believed to fall into the fifth, making them formidable foes...when not enthralled by curses.<tab>Ye'd 'ave t' be blinder'n an ahriman wi' an eyepatch t' miss the camp. - Baderon Tenfingers

Summon forth the single-horned steed you befriended in the Black Shroud.<tab>Not long ago, Eorzean unicorns numbered in the thousands, and could oft be seen roaming the Coerthas highlands in great majestic herds that would render the mountains white as snow. Poaching has caused the population to decline, and if it were not for your act of kindness, there would be one fewer.<tab>Your precious horses, they're just unicorns with a big empty forehead. - Chief Chocowacker

Summon your mighty behemoth, trained from birth to carry you...not trample you underfoot like an ant.<tab>Immediately following the Calamity, an adventurer returning to Gridania from Falcon's Nest in Coerthas claims to have happened upon a den of baby behemoths who had lost their mother. Despite objections from friends and family alike, she kept the beasts, eventually training them to serve as mounts.<tab>Do not presume to provoke the behemoth to battle. You will die. - Meurise

Призовите своего кавалерийского драка, обученного Братством Пепла.<tab>Обучение таких драков — долгий и трудный процесс, который начинается с момента вылупления чешуйчатого существа. Никогда не позволяя увидеть свою мать, они воспитываются исключительно в присутствии дрессировщиков, что бы они не заимствовали привычку использовать свои зажигательные желёза от взрослых особей драков, делая их одновременно покорным, но и такими же смертоносными.<tab>Ты — как потерянный котёнок, который забрёл в логово драков. —Загозз Тех

Summon your laurel goobbue, towering friend to the sylphs.<tab>After having the moss and flowers growing upon his head pulled up and tossed aside like common weeds by a band of sylvan ne'er-do-wells, this quiet-mannered goobbue was taken in and cared for by the sylphs of Little Solace whose elders crafted for him a magnificent laurel with which to hide his scars.<tab>Naught is as exhilarating as a romp through the forest on goobbueback. - Unknown

Call into battle your gilded suit of magitek armor. Its golden coating serves to resist magicks while impressing members of the opposite sex.<tab>It only took a few heated skirmishes with the allied city<var 1F /var>states for Garlemald to realize that the magicks wielded by the realm's mages were too much for even the thickest of magitek armor plating. Alloyed gilding has since been discovered to dampen the effects of elemental charges and is now standard issue.<tab>You ditched your magitek armor!? Fool of a Lalafell! - Biggs

Призовите однорогого коня с характером, таким же чёрным, как его шерсть.<tab>Хотя ни для кого не секрет, что именно загадочные Асцианцы навевают кошмары на звериные племена, причины, по которым они это делают, остаются окутанными тайной. В остальном же они неукротимы, и единственный пронзительный звук волшебного свистка — единственный известный способ успокоить диких зверей.<tab>Узрите кошмар в реальности и приготовьтесь к грядущему хаосу! — Урианже

Summon forth your fat chocobo mount. Take care that there is sufficient room for his ample girth.<tab>Playfully described by some as “large and in charge,” in truth, when summoned, this gluttonous gourmand will flap nary a feather unless a garland of gysahl greens is dangled before him─in which case not even the laws of nature can slow the fat chocobo down.<tab>Huff...huff...heave...heave... - Fat Chocobo

Summon your cavalry elbst, raised from an egg by Pahh of Novv's Clutch.<tab>To ensure his elbst do not find themselves at a disadvantage to swift-running chocobos, Pahh of Novv's Clutch clips the webbing on their feet at a young age, rendering them more capable of achieving high speeds on land─though they will ever be slower than their brethren while underwater.<tab>My elbst is your elbst. - Pahh

Призовите множество бомб, которые понесут вас в комфорте на парящем паланкине.<tab>Узнав, что его творениям вечно не хватает энергии горения, аколит 789-го ордена Ба Го создал то, что сделал бы любой мастер взрывного дела — прикрепил бомбы к углам железной скамьи и создал парящую повозку.<tab>Рубить, кромсать, а так же всё взрывать. Бам, бум, бадабум.♪ — Гоблин Дидди

Призовите Аитона, легендарного коня, которого любили первобытный бог Ифрит. Говорят, что его дыхание горячо, как седьмой ад.<tab>Легенда гласит, что владыка преисподней Ифрит выковал этого заколдованного коня из Кошмара, принесенного в жертву амал'джа.<tab>Нет, это всего лишь отзвуки от ударов копыт! — Ума Бугё

Призовите Ксантоса, легендарного коня, которого любила первобытная богиня Гаруда. Считается, что на полном скаку он может стать самим ветром.<tab>Легенда гласит, что владычица вихря, Гаруда, создала этого заколдованного коня из кошмара, принесённого Иксалом в жертву.<tab>Нет, это всего лишь отзвуки от ударов копыт! —Ума Бугё

Призовите Гуллфакси, легендарного коня, которого любил первобытный Титан. Его мощные ноги вызывают дрожь, которую можно почувствовать за несколько миль.<tab>Легенда гласит, что Владыка Крэгов, Титан, создал этого заколдованного коня из кошмы, принесенной кобольдами в жертву.<tab>Нет, это всего лишь стук копыт! — Ума Бугё

Призовите Энбарра, легендарного коня, которого любил первобытный бог Левиафан. Считается, что он был рождён из вздымающихся волн.<tab>Легенда гласит, что Левиафан, владыка водоворота, породил этого заколдованного коня из кошмара, принесённого сахаджином в жертву.<tab>Нет, это всего лишь отзвуки от ударов копыт! — Ума Бугё

Summon forth your fearless warlion to rule over the battlefield, such is his station as king of the beasts.<tab>Early in the Sixth Astral Era, lions were brought over from the Near East and trained to serve as battle mounts for the Sultansworn of Ul'dah. Deemed unbreakable, those not sold to the Coliseum for venationes were released into the deserts of Thanalan where they eventually reverted back to a feral state.<tab>I, too, see the friends I lost in the lions and spinners... - Gregory

Summon forth your fearless warbear, veteran of a thousand battles, to fill your enemies with dread.<tab>In generations past, warriors seeking fame and glory would journey out into the untamed wilds of Abalathia's Spine in search of the giant grizzled bears that roamed the mountains, and would wrestle the beasts into submission, riding their prizes back to civilization. That is, or die trying.<tab>How do you like my pets? Not too playful for you, I hope? - Beast Trainer

Summon forth your draught chocobo, a massive bird large and strong enough to bear two riders.<tab>This heretofore unseen breed of chocobo was said to have been discovered by chocobo hunters searching for the legendary Chocobo Forest. Its enormous size would make it a fine pack chocobo, but its foul temper prevents it from completing even the simplest of tasks without the injury of some poor rider.<tab>The thing was thrice my size and had already maimed several keeps. - Battlewarden Ribald

Позовите своего ужасного волка, одного из пяти детёнышей, найденных прижавшимися друг к другу в снегу рядом с трупом их убитой матери.<tab>Массовое уничтожение зверей во время Шестой Астральной Эры заставило натуралистов считать этот вид вымершим. Однако это утверждение оказалось ложным, когда иксалы-разведчики обнаружили одинокую стаю, бродящую по малонаселённым горам Зельфатола.<tab>Я потерял двух хороших людей из-за этих волков. —Корентио Холодный

Summon forth your Maelstrom-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone.<tab>After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage during Frontline campaigns.<tab>Hoof to neigh, Eorzea knows not the horse for one reason: the horsebird. - Uma Bugyo

Summon forth your Order of the Twin Adder-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone.<tab>After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage during Frontline campaigns.<tab>Hoof to neigh, Eorzea knows not the horse for one reason: the horsebird. - Uma Bugyo

Summon forth your Immortal Flames-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone.<tab>After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage during Frontline campaigns.<tab>Hoof to neigh, Eorzea knows not the horse for one reason: the horsebird. - Uma Bugyo

Призовите Маркаба, легендарного коня, которого любил первобытный Раму. Говорят, что он родился от одной молнии.<tab>Легенда гласит, что владыка молний, Раму, призвал этого заколдованного коня из кошмара, принесённого сильфами в жертву.<tab> Нет, это всего лишь эхо от удара копыт! — Ума Бугё

Summon forth your ceremony chocobo, large enough to bear both you and your special someone.<tab>Raised by Ishgard's master breeders for beauty and purity of stock, its snow white feathers are natural and, though fully developed, as soft as down. Temperament-wise, the bird is remarkably docile and one of few breeds who will allow dual riders upon its back.<tab>Don't stand on ceremony, tick-tock, tick-tock! - Helmhart

Summon forth Sleipnir─undying steed of the elder primal Odin. His coat is as dark as void, while his eyes glow a sanguine red.<tab>Blessed by the elder primal himself, Sleipnir will forever remain loyal to those who have proven themselves worthy. In addition to being fearless in battle, the dark steed is also able to manipulate his corporeal form to accommodate any rider, large or small.<tab>If it hadn't been for that horse... - Erik

Вызовите Борея, легендарного коня, которого любила первобытная богиня Шива. Считается, что его дыхание порождает зимние бури.<tab>Легенда гласит, что владычица мороза Шива сотворила этого волшебного коня из единорога, принесённого её последователями в жертву.<tab>Нет, это всего лишь отзвуки от ударов копыт! — Ума Бугё

Summon forth your parade chocobo who, by the looks of him, has not marched in many parades.<tab>Originally purchased by the Adventurers' Guild for use in festival parades, this portly steed quickly wore out his welcome by devouring a moon's worth of fodder in a single turn of the sun. Unable to pay the price of upkeep, the guild passed the reins to someone more “commendable.”<tab> I'll be at the parade with whomever else I can drag along. - Botulf

Summon de forth your black de chocobo. <tab>A purebred Ishgardian black chocobo, trained from birth by House Fortemps knight, Ser Haurchefant, and presented to you in a gesture of true friendship. The bird is slightly more muscular than you expected and exhibits the strange habit of squatting when left to itself.<tab>Black chocobos are all well and good, but the true reward is the exoneration of your comrades. - Haurchefant

Summon forth your adamantoise mount. He(?) is actually quite faster than he appears.<tab>Native to the Near Eastern island of Thavnair, adamantoises were long thought to be impossible to domesticate. However, through the efforts of both Ul'dahn naturalists and thaumaturges, a handful have been successfully trained not only to accept riders, but also wield ancient magicks which allow the colossal scalekin to fly.<tab>M-Me? Perfectly fine! S-Solid as an adamantoise! - Cocobezi

Summon forth Kirin, Far Eastern king of the beasts.<tab>Ask any man in Othard who rules the realm of beasts, and you will receive the same answer─Kirin. It is believed that the lionlike creature has walked the eastern lands for over a thousand years and will only answer the call of a hero it has deemed worthy.<tab>Even folk in the Far East 'eard that tale, I reckon. - Trachraet

Call into battle your Allagan logistics system. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled.<tab>One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to maintain and protect their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere was modified by Nero tol Scaeva into a personal transportation device.<tab>Her report also mentions a violent encounter with a sentry heavily augmented by Allagan technology... - Rammbroes

Summon forth a purebred Abalathian hoarhound named after its pack's legendary leader.<tab>Following the rise of Ishgard, hoarhounds all but disappeared from the Coerthas highlands. However, the shift in climate caused by the Calamity has seen the legendary beasts descend from their mountain dens once more.<tab>A good hound keeps his maw shut. - Latata

Summon forth Midgardsormr, the slightly bigger one, but still not <var 1A 02 /var>the<var 1A 01 /var> big one.<tab>Only after proving your bravery in the face of countless perils has the Father of Dragons found you to be a worthy heir to the Light, and granted you a place upon his back.<tab>Correct me if I'm wrong, but if Midgardsormr had roared, wouldn't we have heard it? - Moenbryda

Summon forth your amber draught chocobo, a rare breed large and strong enough to bear two riders.<tab>To Ishgardians, red represents true love and loyalty. To this wild chocobo from the Dravanian forelands, it meant capture at the hands of hunters who easily found a red chocobo sticking out like a sore thumb in the midst of all his yellow brethren.<tab>What about my forty acres and a chocobo? - Imme

Summon forth your sanuwa, specially bred and trained for riding by Gundu merchant Luna Vanu.<tab>Countless turns of the sun did Luna Vanu train this wild sanuwa to obey the orders of man, and for many moons did he wait for one he deemed worthy of taking up this noble cloudkin's reins. Wait, he did, until you arrived.<tab>Wild sanuwa fierce as monsoon rains. - Gunu Vanu

Summon forth your griffin─half eagle, half lion, all business.<tab>Fantastical winged beasts native to the unscalable peaks of Abalathia's Spine, griffins actually have a long history of serving as mounts. Indeed, before the city<var 1F /var>state's fall, the Ala Mhigan army maintained a regiment of griffin<var 1F /var>back soldiers who would harry opposing forces.<tab>“Spread your wings and soar” - Highwind Skyways Slogan

Call into battle your manacutter, a single-rider airship constructed at the Garlond Ironworks.<tab>Supervised (in spirit) by the ever-absent Cid, Biggs and Wedge (with a little bending over by Biggs) put their heads together to create this flight-ready miniature airship, powered by the realm's first corrupted crystal engine.<tab>There are more of these “manacutters” to be had, yes? - Aymeric

Summon forth your war panther─a silent killer trained to maim anyone and everything...excepting you, of course.<tab>While more difficult to train than their cousins the coeurls, panthers bring their riders much more advantage on the field due to the beasts' inherent affinity to various magic. It is also believed that many dark knight battle techniques were conceived by watching panthers hunt.<tab>I have seen you move like a shadow. - Daimbert

Call into battle your gobwalker, a steam-powered war vehicle designed by the infamous Illuminati.<tab>Originally designed to be a less-fickle replacement for pack raptors, the gobwalker was quickly reoutfitted into a tool of war after it took twenty goblins to chase down and topple a walker that had gone out of control and destroyed an entire workshop.<tab>Ye would have more luck findin'...well, a gobmachine bangplate on a tree! - Papana

Summon forth Twintania, an ancient wyvern who secretly dreams of freedom...and devouring you.<tab>Bound to eternal thralldom via an Allagan neurolink, this ancient wyvern from the southern continent of Meracydia will remain a loyal servant as long as you possess its identification key.<tab>There are wyverns. Wyverns everywhere. - Vath Drone

Summon forth your witch's broom. Here is to hoping it refrains from “flipping you over, flip flip” while flying.<tab>Once an ordinary household cleaning tool, relegated to such menial tasks as sweeping and...sweeping, this broom's life changed upon being enchanted by the ogre pumpkinhead. Now the skies are its dusty floors.<tab>Are you going to introduce yourself to that broom or not? - Matoya

Summon forth a pegasus─winged white horse of legend.<tab>While rumors of a winged horse have graced ancient tomes for centuries, until recently, very little in the way of proof of their existence remained save the random feather or horseshoe housed in some remote monastery's reliquary.<tab>Sprout wings, I will! - You

Call into battle the White Devil─Livia sas Junius's custom-made battle armor, now <var 1A 02 /var>your<var 1A 01 /var> custom-made battle armor.<tab>This masterpiece of imperial ingenuity is the selfsame suit of warmachina operated by XIVth Legion tribunus Livia sas Junius in the Garlean Empire's subjugation of Othard's southern reaches.<tab>Ever the pessimist, my dear Livia. - Nero tol Scaeva

Call into battle the Red Baron─Nero tol Scaeva's custom-made battle armor, now <var 1A 02 /var>your<var 1A 01 /var> custom-made battle armor.<tab>Constantly modified and improved by Nero himself, this warmachina of Garlean construct barely resembles the suit issued to tol Scaeva on the day of his promotion to tribunus.<tab>That mechanical monstrosity represented a feat of engineering far beyond aught Garlemald can presently achieve. - Cid

Summon forth your wyvern, master of the skies and forever-loyal servant.<tab>Fifty score years ago, this wyvern made a pact with a knight to aid in vanquishing evil from the skies. Even now, long after the knight's passing, the wyvern has kept that promise, ever circling the heavens─ignoring the calls of his brethren to take up arms against mankind.<tab>A wyvern... I'd only ever heard stories about them. - Saintrelmaux

Call into battle the SDS Fenrir, a lore-bending battlebike that looks as if it was driven straight from an age unknown.<tab>Manufactured for use by the now-defunct Strife Delivery Service, this two-wheeled monstrosity's ceruleum engine howls like the silver wolf of legend as it propels its rider across desert and plain.<tab>Misfortune is no excuse for failing a delivery! - Hildeyerd

Summon forth your kongamato, raised with care by the Vath stickpeddler.<tab>After hatching from an egg laid near the riverbanks, the kongamato larva spends its early life as a water-dwelling insect. Its maturity is signified by metamorphosis, during which its wings sprout forth and it takes to the skies.<tab>Kongamato can be fickle─yes, very fickle─but they always return home to us. - Vath Kintamer

Summon forth your zu. Its weighty wings have carried it from the Near East.<tab>This massive bird hunts by grasping its prey within its saw-like beak, and finishes it off with a few violent shakes of its long neck before swallowing the now-dead quarry whole.<tab>Could you imagine how noisy it'd be with even more anzu flying around, kupo? - Mogoon

Summon forth the mythical bennu. Very few have had the privilege of viewing this bird up close.<tab>This bird was reborn after drinking deep of the aether that flowed forth from the immortal Phoenix, who appeared in the skies of Carteneau during the Calamity. Named after a legendary bird, bennu means “a shining object, rising in brilliance.”<tab>'Twixt this world and the next do the aetherial currents swirl, bearing the very essence of life. - Urianger

Summon forth the white lanner. Favored of the primal Bismarck, he soars the skies unchallenged.<tab>These birds are clad in roiling clouds, and noble Vanu Vanu warriors would sit astride them as part of Bismarck's retinue. The grace with which they glide through the skies evokes the image of a flower petal being carried by gentle western winds.<tab>From what we have observed, Bismarck is a creature of pure instinct, driven primarily by hunger. - Cid

Summon forth the rose lanner. Favored of the primal Ravana, his wings pierce the night sky like a blade of moonlight.<tab>The ferocity of these birds is enough to give pause to the bravest warrior, and their keen talons cut through flesh as cleanly the Chandrahas themselves. Any who endeavor to mount the rose lanner must possess the savagery that defines the Wrath of the Colony.<tab>Master of the Sacred Blades! Wrath of the Colony! Conqueror of the World! Hear our prayer! - Gnath Priest

Summon forth the round lanner. Favored of the primal King Thordan, he serves his master's knights dutifully.<tab>These birds are possessed of dignity equal to the noble personages whom they serve. Ancient Ishgardian knights often indulged themselves in falconry, and lanners were revered for their abilities, their lyncean eyes being well suited for sighting prey on the ground.<tab>For the glory of King Thordan... - Zephirin

Summon forth the warring lanner. Favored of the primal Sephirot, it carries the seeds of the World Tree.<tab>These birds are enveloped in an aura radiating a majesty that belies the savage nature of their master. According to the ancient legends of a treelike people native to Meracydia, the lanners bore the seeds of the World Tree across the seas, planting the verdant forests that dot the realm today.<tab>The trunk of the World Tree, or the Bole, offers protection to the weak, defending them from harm. - Mace

Summon forth the Gloria-class airship. This single-occupancy airship is a singular feat of engineering.<tab>Taking inspiration from the half-remembered dream of his grandfather Tatanora, Tataramu used his encyclopedic knowledge to design a small-scale version of a rotary-winged airship. Its name derives from an airship that appears in an obscure novel of unknown origins.<tab>No, it must be one made to extremely exacting specifications. - Tataramu

Summon forth the flying cumulus. It is unclear whether its previous owner was a boy with a tail or simply a monkey.<tab>There is but one man in all of Hydaelyn who can create such a mystical masterpiece, and it is said he resides upon a misty peak hidden within the mountain ranges of Doma. Crafted by stitching together dozens of smaller clouds, the cumulus allows a single rider to explore the skies...but only if she has an inherent affinity for magicks.<tab>Mental note: pick no quarrel with Domans. - Thancred

Summon forth the original fat chocobo. Of course, being the original, it can eat much more than its peers.<tab>Maybe not larger, but definitely more in charge, this most gluttonous of gluttons inspired the others to great weights. Although most modern chocobos have yellow plumage, historic tomes portray birds covered in feathers whiter than the whitest snowfall─ All the better to see the stains of its many meals.<tab>Heave...heave...huff...huff... - Original Fat Chocobo

Summon forth Astrope. A fully grown pegasus large enough to bear you and a companion across gentle skies.<tab>The emergent studies of winged horses had to be rewritten with a single sighting of Astrope, confirming that adult pegasi are not only enormous in size, but also possessed of a horn. Wary of most, Astrope only allows those of gentle heart to climb upon its back─a back large enough to seat two!<tab>Spread our wings and soar, we shall! - Sezul Totoloc

Summon forth the fat moogle. How can he fly? Because magic. How can he fly bearing two riders? MAGIC.<tab>This plus-sized patrician epitomizes the ancient moogle proverb regarding kupo nuts that says, “Once you kupop, you cannot stop.” Basic laws of physics suggest that wings as small as the fat moogle's should not provide enough lift for true flight...yet here we are.<tab>Yet what was thin must eventually grow fat again. - Aurelle

Summon forth a cloud mallow. It will carry you wherever the wind blows. Or, wherever you steer it.<tab>While cloud mallows grow naturally in the Churning Mists, some of the inhabitants of Moghome have spent generations cultivating their own seeds to allow for stronger stems and larger yields of mallow puffs, a sprinkling of which can stimulate even the most lethargic of moogles to work with unbridled joy.<tab>Without my cloud mallows, I can't do anything, kupopo! - Moggzia

Призовите свою гандолу-Уиспер. Маленькое летающее судно, созданное по образу и подобию йо-кая по имени Уиспер.<tab>Захваченный яркими видами «Золотого Блюдца», странник обратился к архитектору этого заведения с просьбой спроектировать ему транспортное средство, схожее по красоте с его многочисленными достопримечательностями. Сиденья имеют такую мягкую обивку, что пассажиры клянутся, будто они парят в воздухе.<tab>Так вот как человек летает без крыльев? Но это так странно выглядит! —Драгонет

Призовите тёмного ланнера. Любимец Нидхёгга, он бесстрашно парит в небесах Бушующих Туманов.<tab>Одержимые злобой, эти птицы гнездятся в логове Нидхёгга и регулярно купаются в эфирных бурях, окружающих Аэри. Вид их светящихся крыльев за пределами Бушующих Туманов может привести в ужас обычного человека, так как они считаются предвестниками смертоносной орды.<tab>Приспешники Нидхёгга не потерпят твоего присутствия на священной горе. —Видофнир

Summon forth your aerodynamics system─marvel of ancient Allagan ingenuity.<tab>Unearthed in the eastern lowlands of Coerthas, engineers surmise that this particular Allagan drone would likely have been used in aerial defense, although its weaponry functions are now beyond repair. Even so, it is still quite convenient as a transportation device.<tab>This node turned out to be rather more useful than I expected! - Cid

Summon forth your disembodied head. Not <var 1A 02 /var>your<var 1A 01 /var> disembodied head. <var 1A 02 /var>A<var 1A 01 /var> disembodied head. That's yours.<tab>E-Una-Kotor created this winged monstrosity using stone hewn from the very walls of the Palace of the Dead in an attempt to better understand the guardian golems which watch over the Lost City of Amdapor. That the face chosen for the design bears an uncanny likeness to a certain someone is one stone best left unturned.<tab>Unggghhh, my head... - Lewenhart

Summon forth Managarm, a legendary hound said to dwell in the hidden depths of Abalathia's Spine.<tab>Some say that Managarm is merely a myth. Others believe it to be an extinct beast. Both are wrong, as you well know. According to Abalathian legend, this fearsome hound roams the celestial sphere in pursuit of the moon, whose light it relishes─or so it may appear to those who witness it soaring the skies, spawning spectral flames.<tab>I should have been the one to feed your dark hound with light! - From an Ancient Epic

Призовите свою особую гандолу-Уиспер. Броская модернизация маленького летающего судна, созданного по образу и подобию йо-кая по имени Уиспер.<tab>Вооодушевлённый вашей непреклонной преданностью и покровительством, странник снова поручил архитекторам «Золотого Блюдца», на этот раз модернизировать гандолу-Уиспер в качестве подарка от себя и своего друга, странствующего менестреля.<tab>Боже! Что это было? Вспышка с небес? Я чуть не ослеп! —Гильгамеш

Summon forth Goten. A man-made aberration from a land that exists only in whispers. Its name is said to mean “roaring heavens.”<tab>This otherworldly mount, cobbled together from the carcasses of noble beasts and armored in elaborate gold plate, is said only to accept as riders those who have proven their might and mettle on the fields of battle.<tab>The horse is merciful and generous in victory. - Golden Uma Doshin

Summon forth Ginga. A man-made aberration from a land that exists only in whispers. Its name is said to mean “silver fang.”<tab>This otherworldly mount, cobbled together from the carcasses of noble beasts and armored in elaborate silver plate, is said only to accept as riders those who have proven their might and mettle on the fields of battle.<tab>Be as the horse, and leave behind all doubts and bafflement! - Black Uma Doshin

Summon forth your mystic panda. From Doma. From a thousand years ago.<tab>Armed with the unexplainable ability to levitate...and little else, this thousand-year-old creature (age unconfirmed) has descended the ancient peaks of the Othardian Fanged Crescent in search of a hero to help Doma wrench free from the iron clutches of the Garlean Empire.<tab>Used to be prime huntin' grounds... that is, till the bears moved in. - Tailfeather Hunter

Призовите своего софического ланнера. Некогда верного слугу капризной богини.<tab>История говорит нам, что нарушение равновесия между добром и злом неизменно приводит к страданиям. Благородный ланнер служит для восстановления этого равновесия, помещая на весы богини Софии гири равновесия, которые чаще всего изображают герои наших легенд.<tab>«Биение сердца без гармонии, как лунный свет без темноты». —Из текста <var 1A 02 /var>софической кантикли<var 1A 01 /var>

Summon forth your Starlight bear, and delight the younglings to no end.<tab>Unlike his wild cousins, <var 09 E948 ((Kochab)) ((<var 08 E905 ((Kochab)) ((Polaris)) /var>)) ((Pferkad)) ((Kochab)) ((Polaris)) ((<var 08 E905 ((Kochab)) ((Polaris)) /var>)) ((Polaris)) ((Kochab)) /var> the bear can be relied upon to delight folk rather than tear them apart. Raised from a cub by Celebrant Baenfaeld, he has mastered the art of Starburst-lobbing, a skill that proved useful in hunting down thieving treants.<tab>I never knew bears could be so adorable! - Festival-goer

Summon forth a black pegasus─winged horse of legend and bringer of death.<tab>While uncommon, tales of pegasi black as ink can be found amongst the folklore of countless tribes. One similarity, however, can be observed in nearly all the renditions─that those unworthy of the steed will have their very life essence sapped the moment they climb upon its back.<tab>What is this malaise which plagues me? - Beatin

Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Oh, oh, oh, Arrhidaeus. Summon forth your Arrhidaeus.<tab>Fabricated within Alexander's internal manufactories, Arrhidaeus was primarily used to wreak temporal disruption on any and all invaders. This particular construct saw its weapons systems overridden following capture, and now serves as a glorified transport module.<tab>You are implying that the Illuminati are aware of this temporal disruption? - Mide

Summon forth Raigo. Whether or not he heeds the call depends entirely on the number of bloodied laurels in your crown.<tab>The most daunting of Mado horses, Raigo eclipses its unholy brethren Goten and Ginga in both size and ferocity. As such, the creature will not suffer the burden of carrying a soul unbloodied, and therefore unworthy.<tab>Your inner horse, my dear adventurer, must be a steed of rare beauty. - Golden Uma Yoriki

Call into battle the Red Baron─Nero tol Scaeva's custom-made battle armor, now <var 1A 02 /var>your<var 1A 01 /var> custom-made battle armor.<tab>Constantly modified and improved by Nero himself, this warmachina of Garlean construct barely resembles the suit issued to tol Scaeva on the day of his promotion to tribunus.<tab>That mechanical monstrosity represented a feat of engineering far beyond aught Garlemald can presently achieve. - Cid

Призовите своего демонического ланнера — символ справедливости по отношению к расам, поклоняющимся Зурвану, которые когда-то процветали на южном континенте Мерасидии.<tab>Кентавры древней Мерасидии верили, что их могущественный бог Зурван перед битвой посылает своего ланнера, чтобы сообщить врагам о их предстоящем поражении.<tab>Он следил за мной, как проклятый ястреб. — Аскетичный искатель приключений

Summon forth your Firebird. Not Phoenix. Definitely not Phoenix.<tab>The Far East is home to numerous legends concerning birds of flame who sacrifice their lives to save the world, only to rise from the ashes of destruction to rule the skies once again. The Firebird is one of those legends...made a mount.<tab>I was hoping for a fine bird. - Grimold

Call into battle your eggshilaration system. Egg puns required for propulsion.<tab>After learning of the latest of the Dreamer's visions─a giant floating ovoid delivering eggs to all the good boys and girls of the realm─Nonotta and friends literally scrambled to find a means of bringing her dream to life. All it required was a little aid from the Sons of Saint Coinach...and the remnants of some ancient Allagan technology.<tab>Why do the Qiqirn suck eggs? - Acolyte Ba Go

Summon forth your lone hellhound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.<tab>Having survived, alone, the hellish darkness that is the void, this demonic beast will not soon suffer the presence of others, choosing typically to attack before he himself becomes a victim. Which is why it is all the more surprising that the hound would allow someone on his back.<tab>What in the seven unholy hells are those gruesome things!? - Laraina

Summon forth your pack hellhound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.<tab>Having commanded armies in the hellish darkness that is the void, this demonic beast will not soon submit at the feet of another. Which is why it is all the more surprising that the hound would allow someone on her back.<tab>A good hound keeps her maw shut. - Latata

Summon forth your Archon throne. Don't call it a high chair.<tab>Despite claims that it was once the chair of Louisoix Leveilleur, former residents of Sharlayan have confirmed that it is naught more than an ordinary furnishing enchanted by a Great Gubal Library bibliophile who was tired of not being able to reach the upper shelves.<tab>There's a chair over there just cryin' out to be sat on. - Baderon

Summon forth Syldra. Even in death, she would want to help.<tab>Legends say there once lived a kindly sea dragon who befriended a pirate, and that their friendship knew no bounds. This is not that sea dragon; however, with a little time and caring, who is to say that a similar relationship cannot be forged? ※Sea dragons have no relation to actual dragons.<tab>I said, get off! - Faris

Залезайте в модель «Сокол» (неофициальное название), самый быстрый одноместный дирижабль, когда-либо сконструированный в Эорзии.<tab>Независимый проект инженера Веджа из «Шестерёнок Гарлонда», эта модель якобы смогла разогнать одну из самых высоких скоростей полёта в истории... но случился трагический несчастный случай при попытке определить, как высоко он сможет взлететь, после чего его создатель решил что необходимо установить некоторые ограничители.<tab>Всё, что вам нужно сделать, это следовать за соколом. Он знает, куда летит. —Борендуэн де Хайленарте

Summon forth your lone faehound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.<tab>Covered from muzzle to tail in an otherworldly silver coat, the faehound appears more akin to something out of a faerie tale than from the nether-reaches of the void. Yet do not be fooled by the beast's appearance, for he is an equal in strength to all but the highest ranking voidsent, his heart swollen with savagery from a lifetime hunting alone.<tab>Dogs is loyal. - Latata

Summon forth your pack faehound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.<tab>Covered from muzzle to tail in an otherworldly silver coat, the faehound appears more akin to something out of a faerie tale than from the nether-reaches of the void. Yet do not be fooled by the beast's appearance, for she is an equal in strength to all but the highest ranking voidsent, her heart swollen with savagery from a lifetime leading a pack of her own.<tab>Are you inclined to think them faerie tales? - Alberic

Призовите своего блаженного камуя, благословенного волка, который не будет связан такими простыми законами, как гравитация или аэродинамика.<tab>Верьте или нет, но этот чудовищный клык не всегда светился, он обрёл свой небесный блеск только после того, как получил благословение Лакшми и был предложен Леди Блаженства её преданными мечтателями Ананты.<tab>Это не одичалый волк, с которым вы могли бы столкнуться в природе. — Гецкин

Призовите своего ликующего камуя, благословенного волка, который не будет связан такими простыми законами, как гравитация или аэродинамика.<tab>Получив от своих почитателей-коджинов в дар грустного, осиротевшего волчонка, Сусано наделил его даром полёта, а также впечатляющей светящейся шёрсткой, чтобы он был достоин любого праздника.<tab>У меня нет нужных слов, чтобы разговаривать с птенцами... если, конечно, ты здесь не для того, чтобы стать волком. —Курьёзный Горж

Call into battle your magitek predator, and have you some fun.<tab>Predator series warmachina were originally designed to improve magitek reaper killing potential via the addition of close-quarter weaponry. While the extra firepower led to a higher kill ratio, the weight it added hampered maneuverability. This unique model appears to have had its weapons removed and replaced with an experimental propulsion engine.<tab>I ain't got time to bleed. - Ancient Adage

Summon forth your battle lion, fully armored to protect the majestic beast from the dangers of close combat.<tab>There was a time when members of Ul'dah's elite Sultansworn strode the Steps of Nald and Thal atop silver-plated lions, striking fear and awe into the mewling masses. An effort to return to those days of glory has seen the summoning of several of Thavnair's most prominent beast tamers to the Rose of the Desert.<tab>Bright as a lamp, brave as a lion. - Haermaga

Summon forth your battle bear, fully armored to protect the savage beast from singeing its lustrous fur on the smoldering carnage left in its wake.<tab>The bears of Abalathia's Spine are not known to suffer the presence of man in their territory, let alone allow one to mount their backs and command them hither and yon. Then what, pray tell, has come over this particular specimen? Perhaps one look into your inner beast convinced the creature that submission spelled survival.<tab>We're after a bear this time!? Oh boy, this should be fun! - Enion

Summon forth your battle panther, fully armored to protect the stealthy beast from the occasional poison dart, poison arrow, poison-tipped spear, poison spell, and any poison words directed its way.<tab>History tells us that no dark hero's story is complete without the companionship of a wily panther. Their sable coat, their savage nature, their attunement with the umbral, their thirst for blood. It is as if the gods created these creatures in the image of a dark knight...or perhaps it was the other way around.<tab>If you help me out, I will tell you more about my feline friend here. - Hinoshin

Summon forth your yol, proof of your recognition by the Azim Steppe Xaela as a true warrior.<tab>High atop the granite peaks of Othard's Fanged Crescent do the yol claim their demesne, descending to the Azim Steppe to prey upon warriors who pretend not to fear the monsters of their ancestor's tales. Rare indeed is it that a yol might cede its back to man, though to those who have proved their mettle, the creatures have been known to make exception.<tab>I must have faith in myself and my yol... - Zealous Mol Warrior

Summon forth Alte Roite, fantastical ur-being generated by Omega within the Deltascape.<tab>While none can be certain the exact intentions of a self-aware interdimensional construct, logic suggests this winged aberration is a reimagination of Alte Roite─a legendary wizard who is said could take the shape of a dragon at will.<tab>That knowledge is my ticket straight to glory. I can't go telling any old person about it. - Bonifoix

Summon forth your Centurio tiger, one mark the Clan actually does not want seen slain.<tab>In a rare display of misguided compassion, a member of Clan Centurio returned from a Hunt with the cub of a slain S-rank mark. Unable to grant it mercy, the veteran took to caring for the beast until his deceit was discovered and his membership revoked. But by then, not a single member could bring themselves to harm the pet they had all come to love.<tab>This game of cat and mouse continued for what seemed an eternity. - Alberic

Summon forth mighty Ixion, legend of the Gyr Abanian highlands.<tab>Ask any Gyr Abanian youth, and she will tell you the story of Ixion, Rhalgr's steed─swift as a levinbolt and strong as thunderclap. However, the discovery of several ancient Mhachi texts suggests that the creature may simply be a stallion augmented by ancient technologies that have granted it life eternal...and the ability to shoot lightning from its eyes.<tab>He said what? “Horses are that strong”? - Red Uma Doshin

Призовите легендарного камуя, благословенного волка, не связанного такими простыми законами, как гравитация или аэродинамика.<tab>Вечно окутанный божественным сиянием, он, как говорят, родился, когда по случайному совпадению, боевая гончая Ала-Мхигана купалась в свете Синрю в момент рождения первородного.<tab>Это деликатный танец... и он требует многого от моих гончих. —Зенос яэ Гальвус

Summon forth your Nezha chariot and travel the skies like a god.<tab>Yanxian legend tells of a chariot that would carry gods and heroes across the heavens that they might keep watch over their earthbound children. Surprisingly, the realm's flora and fauna are unscathed by the fire and wind belched forth by the divine carriage.<tab>You look to me like a <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> in need of a nice, relaxin' carriage ride! - Bremondt

Summon forth your striped ray, a majestic creature native to the Ruby Sea.<tab>Raised and trained by the Kojin, this striped ray has the same mellow temperament as its original masters. Its flat body works in like fashion to the aether-imbued wings of an airship, allowing it to catch water- and wind-aspected aether to glide through both sea and sky with ease.<tab>I advise you to stand back when he regurgitates everything. - Zukin

Summon forth your Aquamarine Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of aquamarine geometry.<tab>Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large aquamarine, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima.<tab>What have we here? An admirer of the arcane? A connoisseur of Carbuncles? - Ulan

Summon forth your Citrine Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of citrine geometry.<tab>Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large citrine, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima.<tab>My, what a splendid thing you are. - Ulan

Summon forth a flying chair to bear you in high style.<tab>Featuring elegant lines and designed to minimize waste, this lovingly crafted chair is bound to fly into the hearts of adventurers the world over. No assembly required.<tab>Maximum load: 240 pz.

Call into battle your magitek avenger, an imperial warmachina made mightier by goblin hands.<tab>The goblins have carried out extensive work on this magitek avenger, among other things changing it from an autonomous killing machine to one requiring a pilot. After all, there's no substituting the satisfaction of dealing vengeance with one's own hands. Sort of.<tab>Pshkohhh! Revenge! - Moundrinx Eightclinks

Summon forth your korpokkur kolossus, a veritable colossus among its kind.<tab>In search of an ideal home, this korpokkur journeyed long malms before finally coming to a stop at the Gold Saucer. The trek across the scorching Sagolii had reduced it to a withered husk, but when next it drank, it experienced what could only be described as an epic rebound.<tab>What have you been feeding this thing? - Forward Maiden

Summon forth the Red Hare─legendary steed known for both its unmatchable speed and its fiery red coat.<tab>Ganen was known for his imposing presence on the battlefield, a trait that can partially be attributed to his mount, the Red Hare─a lightning-swift steed magicked to stride the very heavens. This horse is said to be a direct descendant of the awe-inspiring stallion. Probably.<tab>...I spring across the battlefield with the swiftness of the rabbit! - Gyosei

Призовитее благосклонного камуя, благословенного волка, который не будет связан такими простыми законами, как гравитация или аэродинамика.<tab>Сказано, что это величественное существо, окутанное ветрами небес, когда-то было жестоким охотником на людей. Однако случайная встреча с повелителем благоденствия Бякко заставила жажду крови в его сердце угаснуть.<tab>Я не ожидал появления этой страшной гончей. —Икс'ран Тиа

Call into battle your magitek death claw, an imperial warmachina based on ancient Allagan technology.<tab>Ancient Allagan weaponry known as an “iron claw” is believed to be the inspiration for this deadly example of imperial ingenuity. While most of the death claws deployed in battle are used for logistical purposes, this particular model has been customized by stationarii units for enemy capture.<tab>Only so many of us find machina pretty, my dear. - Mide

Summon forth your marid, trained by the Ananta and outfitted with a magicked carpet allowing for flight.<tab>There was once a time when if someone told you they witnessed a marid aloft, you could have had them committed to a sanatorium. Now, marids crisscross the skies thanks, in part, to magicked carpets which the Ananta affix to the backs of beasts they train for battle.<tab>A rampaging marid is absolutely unssstoppable. - Dakshina

Summon forth your true griffin, a noble winged beast native to the hidden reaches of Abalathia's Spine.<tab>Covered in the pristine white feathers representative of a true griffin, this native of Abalathia's Spine has been trained by Giff, one of the Ala Mhigan Resistance's most competent handlers. So tame is the creature that it will even emit powerful bursts of air on command.<tab>Their meat's supposed to be some of the best around. - Papin

Summon forth your tyrannosaur and experience firsthand a lost time when scalekin ruled the world.<tab>Alarmed scholars report that the “T-Rex”—as it is called by those short on ink—has gained the power of flight through continued exposure to the Isle of Val's turbulent aether. Despite its ferocious nature, some still approach it, insisting it can be tamed by an adventurer of great strength. <tab>The tyrannosaurs have become pests as of late. - Vath Keeneye

Summon forth your Regalia Type-G, ceruleum-powered magitek transportation vehicle crafted by Garlond Ironworks.<tab>To hear Cid tell it, equal parts elbow grease and gumption were all that was required to see the Type-G (for “Garlond”) fully operational...when, in all truth, the otherworldly carriage most likely required an amazing amount of reverse engineering to recreate.<tab>Do they truly believe it makes them look more imposing? Or are they merely compensating for something? - Lalai

Summon forth your broken heart─a magicked chair representing the right half of a Valentione's Day heart.<tab>Burdened with a warehouse of unsold broken heart chairs, House Valentione came up with the diabolic plan to repurpose the cushions with cloudsbreath and peddle them to the unknowing masses as flying mounts.<tab>But alas...the heart will not be denied. - Byakudan

Summon forth your broken heart─a magicked chair representing the left half of a Valentione's Day heart.<tab>Burdened with a warehouse of unsold broken heart chairs, House Valentione came up with the diabolic plan to repurpose the cushions with cloudsbreath and peddle them to the unknowing masses as flying mounts. Lady Lisette dreams of one day riding the hearts on her honeymoon.<tab>But alas...the heart will not be denied. - Byakudan

Summon forth Typhon, hideous voidsent aberration and standout employee at the Manderville Gold Saucer.<tab>Since his summoning from the void by the Thaumaturges' Guild, Typhon has experienced his share of ups and downs. Through an employment opportunity at the Manderville Gold Saucer, however, the gaping-mawed horror─described by close acquaintances as quiet and reserved─has (figuratively speaking) landed back on his feet.<tab>Is that your st-stomach I hear rumbling? - Ultros

Призовите лунного камуя, благородного волка, благословлённого Владычицей Луны.<tab>От того, что дикий волк, живущий в заброшенной имперской крепости, купается в эфире возрождённой богини, следует ожидать удивительных результатов.<tab>Да разве солнце в своей полуденном сиянии затмит луну в ночи, тихой и одинокой? —Сейгецу Просветлённый

Summon forth your noble dodo─hopefully not the last one in existence.<tab>For centuries people of the Far East believed the dodo lost─the cloudkin hunted to extinction by poachers who would use its feathers for petticoats and its eggs for cheesy omelettes. The recent discovery of a nest in the upper echelons of Heaven<var 1F /var>on<var 1F /var>High, however, has given naturalists hope that the species may still endure.<tab>Those are some interestin'-lookin' dodos ye've got there. - Jacke

Summon forth a massive whale straight from the Indigo Deep. If only you could do this with fish as well.<tab>Pods of these massive wavekin are believed to traverse the Indigo Deep for thousands of malms in pursuit of food. Why they would choose to limit themselves to the confines of the sea despite possessing the capacity for aether-assisted flight is a mystery scholars have pondered for centuries.<tab>Why, what a whale you've whisked out of the whitecaps! - Wawalago

Summon forth your mighty Rathalos─a wyvern far, far from home.<tab>Many a brave hunter has attempted to topple this flame-belching beast from his fiery throne atop the forest, yet only a few can claim to have conquered the King of the Skies.<tab>The wyverns are scary. Is there no safe place? - Wandering Gnath

Call into battle your magitek conveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics.<tab>It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so for the past twenty summers, imperial magitek engineers have been perfecting the art of aerial transport. Surprisingly, it is not outfitted with an active weapons system─clearly an oversight that will be amended in the next model.<tab>I cannot begin to comprehend what our visitor is trying to convey. - OIC Administrator

Call into battle your prototype magitek conveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics.<tab>It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so, not a single moon after the completion of their new conveyor system, imperial magitek engineers returned to the drawing board to improve upon their creation─replacing existing steel exoplates with <var 1A 02 /var>high-quality<var 1A 01 /var> steel exoplates.<tab>You are not <var 1A 02 /var>supposed<var 1A 01 /var> to be able to descend of your own volition. - Nero tol Scaeva

Summon your team of Namazu bearers, carrying a garish mikoshi upon which to precariously perch as they waddle to your destination.<tab>Due to excessive zeal on the part of Gyoshin, this mikoshi was crafted with more cloudsbreath than is necessary or, indeed, safe. Thus, it not only floats atop the shoulders of its bearers, it soars aloft regardless of their presence─though that does not discourage them from clinging to its poles anyway.<tab>Wasshoi! Wasshoi! Wassh─ Ow! I think I pulled something... - Gyoshin

Summon Juedi, and jump straight to ludicrous speed.<tab>Its ancient Doman name loosely translating to “ludicrously swift steed that runs so fast its feet no longer touch the ground,” Juedi is yet another horse of legend, showered with geomantic magicks to grant the creature the gift of flight.<tab>How mightily <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> must have toiled to <var 1A 02 /var>become<var 1A 01 /var> a horse... - Haurchefant

Call into battle your Allagan logistics node. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled.<tab>One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to oversee logistics in their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere was off-loaded to the Eorzean Alliance and modified into a personal transportation device.<tab>Allagan technology, eh? - Fyrgeiss

Call into battle your Allagan safeguard system. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled.<tab>One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to maintain and protect their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere's processing unit was updated with the aid of Garlond Ironworks engineers to improve security.<tab>The system crashes... - Ardashir

Summon Grani, heroic steed from a realm not your own.<tab>Possessed of a strength of both mind and body that is unmatched in the First, as a mount, Grani has no peer on land nor in the heavens. It is said, however, the noble creature will only accept a rider who has pledged to restore shadow to a land bereft of night.<tab>The lives of my men may depend upon the swiftness of your steed... - Topher

Summon your fatter cat─fatter than a fat cat, obviously.<tab>Seeing as how this pursy pussy can defy the very laws of physics by propelling itself high into the firmament, it is very likely that the creature is either a voidsent using a bloated cat's corpse as its corporeal vessel, or a deceased pet reanimated by one well versed in the necromantic arts.<tab>The entire city would be overrun with large-testicled raccoon dogs and flying rainbow cats... - Kyokuho

Призовите своего благозвучного камуя, благородного волка, благословлённого алым покровительством Судзаку.<tab>Пожертвовав своей жизнью ради спасения хозяина, этот великолепный пёс был избавлен от воздействия потоков жизненной силы, покровительством Судзаку и её алым пламенем возрождения.<tab>Да, да, это дух, маленькие волчёнки... —Бесплотный голос

Call into battle your Model O, autonomous aerial transport device constructed in Omega's interdimensional manufactory.<tab>Though it is difficult to fathom why Omega would require a weaponless flying mount designed to comfortably accommodate a denizen of Hydaelyn, Garlond Ironworks engineers posit the construct was fabricated in an attempt to better understand its enemies.<tab>'Tis one of Omega's creations. - Midgardsormr

Призовите в бой свой Магитех-мехалёт, современную гарлеанскую технологию полётов по доступной цене.<tab>После отказа двигателя эта одноместная боевая машина была брошена на поле боя, и её спасли члены Эорзийского альянса, после отправив устройство в «Шестерёнки Гарлонда» для исследования и дальнейшего ремонта.<tab>НеОбХоДиМо... ВоСсТаНоВиТь... БрОнЮ... — Цукумо

Summon forth your magicked carpet. Fantasy will set you free. Finally.<tab>It is said an ancient king of Corvos, upon conquering a tribe of faeries, bid the faerie queen weave her magicks to forge an object the likes mankind had never seen. The queen was executed shortly after presenting the king with a flying carpet. This is not <var 1A 02 /var>that<var 1A 01 /var> carpet, but at least no one was slain in its creation.<tab>Just be careful not to spill any beverages on the carpets. - Choir Moogle

Call into battle your magna roader and try not to think too hard on why it is called such.<tab>Following their discovery of an imperial roader abandoned in Gyr Abania, several clever goblins came up with the ingenious plan to refurbish the damaged warmachina. The auto-pilot systems, however, were beyond repair, so the engineers were forced to compromise by adding a mannable cockpit.<tab>We have a long road ahead of us. - Mogzin

Summon forth your fat black chocobo and marvel at its flurry of pitch-dark plumage.<tab>According to those familiar with this prodigious poultry's journey from flightless fledgling to full-blown fowl, the cloudkin achieved its staggering girth after several summers of gluttonously gulping chunks of charred chicken. Though, many speculate that the chocobo is, in fact, no chocobo at all, but a heretofore unseen spirit (or demon) of Dravania's dark wood.<tab>Black winds bring terrible news! - Linu Vali

Summon forth your Eldthurs, named for a fiery giant who once ruled a realm of flame with his brothers.<tab>Despite the imposing name, naturalists believe Eldthursar to be naught but yeti whose ancestors forswore their icy mountain homes, choosing instead the molten lakes of Pyros to raise their young. Though not necessarily known for their obedience, this particular specimen has been trained to accept the orders of a rider without taking a bite out of her thigh.<tab>The giants were... thorough in their work. - Alianne

Call into battle your maxima roader─many times mightier than the mightiest of magna roaders.<tab>Following their discovery of an imperial roader abandoned in Gyr Abania, several clever goblins came up with the ingenious plan to not only refurbish the damaged warmachina, but to improve upon its design by adding cermet alloy exoplating and reorganizing synthetic musculature.<tab>We've a bloody long road ahead of us. - Mitsuba

Summon forth Sabotender Emperador and bask in his desert sun radiance.<tab>No one knows exactly why the Manderville Gold Saucer was built to resemble a sabotender, just as no one knows why its mascot is a sabotender or why more than half of its drink menu features sabotender-themed “cact-tails.” This giant flying sabotender will not see you any closer to those answers, but it is fun to stare at.<tab>Very fleet of foot, those sabotenders. - Mayaru Moyaru

Призовите Девятихвостого Камуя, легендарного покровителя, совершенно не связанного с Девятихвостым Кюби.<tab>Только тот, кто доказал свою ценность, приручив не менее семи Камуев, сможет призвать этого легендарного покровителя из её небесных недр. Несмотря на очевидное сходство с <var 1A 02 /var> другим <var 1A 01 /var> лисами — Девятихвостыми Кюби, эта нестареющая лисица имеет свою собственную историю... которая, к сожалению, слишком длинна, чтобы рассказывать её здесь.<tab>Самая почитаемая среди Камуев — Кюби, явилась! —Бродячий менестрель

Призовите своего освящённого Камуя, благородного волка, благословленного лазурным покровителем Сейрю.<tab>Покинутый своим хозяином, этот верный пёс был обнаружен покровителем Сейрю и получил новую жизнь на службе тысячелетнего повелителя.<tab>Волк! Или... по крайней мере у него большие уши и длинный пушистый хвост! —Нашу Мхакаракка

Summon forth your war tiger to tear the enemy's morale to shreds with its cruel, curved fangs.<tab>Even among tigers, the sabertooth is said to be notoriously difficult to tame, but those creatures raised from birth may come to bear riders upon their backs and into war.<tab>T-T-T-T-T-TIGERS!!! - Hapless Namazu

Summon your Eurekan petrel, because who hasn't dreamed of gazing down upon all creation from the mantle of a wind-borne gastropod?<tab>Of all the species of petrels known to man, the Eurekan petrel is the only one which is not actually a petrel, but, in fact, an oversized carnivorous sea slug. Admittedly, unlike most sea slugs, this unique variety possesses the capacity for extended flight, hence the understandable misnomer.<tab>I know you love me, little swallow, but sometimes you just have to let go! - Karasu

Call into battle your magitek avenger A1─outfitted and optimized for alpine warfare.<tab>Proving once again there is naught a Garlean engineer can do that a goblin cannot do better, this magitek avenger, nicknamed the “Yeti,” has been repurposed with several layers of self-insulating exoplating, which draw on the ceruleum engine's residual heat to keep the rider warm even in the coldest of climes.<tab>I'll avenge myself, kupo! - Pukla Puki

Call into battle Demi-Ozma─the round mound of spellbound.<tab>After concluding that Ozma of the Weeping City was but a preliminary attempt to weave an aether-based simulacrum of the Eurekan phenomenon Proto Ozma, the Students of Baldesion endeavored to apply similar magicks in the creation of what they dubbed “Demi-Ozma,” hoping to learn what makes the entity tick.<tab>Follow the sphere! - X'rhun Tia

Summon forth your amaro, Norvrandt's favorite beast of burden.<tab>Of all the mounts seen in Norvrandt, naught is more ubiquitous than the amaro. Originally created by the mages of ancient Ronka, who selectively bred the flightless cama, present-day beasts carry the seed of their ancestors, which may manifest in the form of superior intellect.<tab>That ever-so-endearing “gwee!” It's enough to melt a man's heart, I tell you. - Lamlyn

Summon forth your skyslipper, the greatest mechanical marvel to ever resemble a shoe.<tab>Once belonging to the imperial family, this unique craft was abandoned in a grotto by its owners due to a malfunction. It was later retrieved via airship and stored in the Crystal Tower, where it lay until its recent rediscovery and restoration by artisans of the Crystalline Mean.<tab>Ready to take us wherever we need to go, aye. Back again too, maybe, if we ask it nicely. - Thancred

Summon forth your fae gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.<tab>Desiring to recreate the fantastical beast known as the dragon, a sorcerer from ages past fashioned a horn imbued with Titania's power. The creature which answers the sound is aglow with fae magicks.<tab>Come to hear about dragon legends, yes, yes? - Gyodo

Summon forth your triceratops seemingly from a page right out of prehistory.<tab>In defiance of its bulk, this prehistoric horned beast has been rendered capable of flight courtesy of its saddle. Employing Ronkan ingenuity, the singular contraption was modified from an artifact discovered within ancient ruins by the moogle Nutsy, fearless leader of the clan of her namesake.<tab>Can you please go and steal a dinosaur egg for us? - Vath Braveheart

Summon forth your ironfrog mover, a dwarven-made automaton.<tab>Dwarven artisans have reinforced this automaton to improve lower body durability as well as installed a propulsion unit to enable flight. The techniques employed in its creation are a jealously guarded secret, and a blight upon the beards of they who betray it.<tab>Lali-ho! - Every Single Dwarf

Summon forth your innocent gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.<tab>Answering to a horn imbued with the almighty Innocence's power, this draconic arcane entity is enveloped in the selfsame glow as the Lightwarden whence it takes its name. Rest assured it is not a sin eater.<tab>It would not do for an unadorned winged lizard to be the protagonist. - Alberic

Summon forth your magicked bed, and dream a little dream of never needing to get up.<tab>Once upon a time, in the Kingdom of Voeburt, there lived a member of the royal family slothful of body but quick of mind. This man desired naught more than to never be parted from his pillow, and so commissioned a bed that could fly...only to swiftly take to the sky without paying for it. He, presumably, lived happily ever after.<tab>Do not your mortal bodies tire? Far better to dwell in dream. - Sri Lakshmi

Summon forth your Circus ahriman, a voidsent bred by the Continental Circus.<tab>Raised in hopes that its Dread Gaze would reap a bountiful harvest of terror, this ahriman proved a disappointment. It has since found a new calling as an adventurer's trusty mount.<tab>You have the eye of an ahriman, Yda. - Y'shtola

Summon forth the sunspun cumulus. It is unclear whether its previous owner was a boy with a tail or simply a monkey.<tab>There is but one man in all of Hydaelyn who can create such a mystical masterpiece, and it is said he resides upon a misty peak hidden within the mountain ranges of Doma. Crafted by stitching together dozens of smaller clouds dyed golden by the sun, this cumulus is said to bring good fortune to its rider.<tab>If you live with your head in the clouds, sooner or later you'll find yourself on your rear. —Брангвин

Summon forth your battle tiger, now with 100% more sharp things with which to terrorize your foes.<tab>In the region of Bozja in Ilsabard, the sabertooth tiger has long been employed in warfare as part of infantry. Many soldiers developed an enduring bond with the beasts, whom they would affectionately refer to as their “kittens.”<tab>Tigers! And they look hungry! - Hapless Namazu

Призовите своего морбола. Крепкая лоза, мягкое сердце... вонь средней паршивости.<tab>Морбол был пойман, что бы принести некую пользу, но он оказался «слишком милым», чтобы поспешно отправиться на небеса, потому был переправлен в гильдию синих магов еще до того, как смог впервые сразиться, но и там его сочли "недостаточно мерзким".<tab>Морбол?! А ведь всё так хорошо начиналось... — Папалимо

Summon forth your portly porxie. Bears you places to the tantalizing smell of cured meats.<tab>A prodigious porxie created by the Nu Mou Lugg Aenc for transportation purposes. Fond of sausages, it oft spends its free time in the curing chamber, and thus has come to take on the aroma. While comfortable to ride thanks to its soft curves, expect regular rumblings from its belly.<tab>Oooh, when I get my hands on those porxienappers... - Uin Nee

Summon forth Epimetheus, an unstoppable vehicle of war. Or at least it would be if it were bigger.<tab>Garlond Ironworks recreated this warmachina from a blueprint acquired by a Scion operative on a covert mission to Garlemald. As the dimensions were missing from the document, however, its size had to be estimated, the resultant vehicle being rather smaller than the original.<tab>I never dreamed that I would have the chance to see such a ferocious warmachina with my own eyes! - Warmachina Fanatic

Summon forth Menoetius. Just like Epimetheus, but more comfortable.<tab>Following their successful recreation of Epimetheus, Garlond Ironworks set out to refine the vehicle's design. Their efforts resulted in Menoetius, a model which retains its predecessor's speed while boasting improved comfort and manufacturability.<tab>Of late, all I can think about is Weapons, Weapons, Weapons. - Warmachina Fanatic

Summon forth your Construct VII. Rumors that it is heavily based on an Ivalician design are entirely unfounded. Well, almost.<tab>Having taken prisoner what they thought was an automaton during a skirmish with the kobolds, Maelstrom officers were shocked to find that it was instead a type of synthetic golem─but not so shocked as to not immediately bring it to Naldiq & Vymelli's for repair and later sale.<tab>So the kobolds are at it again... - Anaoc

Summon forth your shadow gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.<tab>Answering to a horn imbued with the power of a sorcerer of eld, this draconic arcane entity is believed to have been created by Emet-Selch on a whim─an act that would have barely taxed his powers as an ancient.<tab>Are you some kind of lesser dragon, kupo? - Mogzin

Summon forth your spriggan stonecarrier. Lives to carry ore, eggs, and you.<tab>Grown to a prodigious size by virtue of its appetite, this spriggan was choking on a chunk of ore when it was found and saved by a band of miners. Seeking to repay the kindness of men, it took to carrying their burdens, which apparently includes men themselves.<tab>It must be so tiring living each day carrying around a brain of solid stone. - Da Za

Summon forth your forgiven reticence. The strong and silent type, so don't expect rousing conversation.<tab>Alerted to its presence in the basement of Eulmore, the hunters of Clan Nutsy set out to vanquish this sin eater. Upon seeing that the creature was not aggressive, however, they decided to keep it instead.<tab>Pray excuse our reticence. - Lucia

Summon forth your dhalmel, a towering herbivore native to the Sea of Clouds.<tab>While attempting to nibble at a tree on a nearby isle, this dhalmel lost its footing and fell. As it plunged towards certain death, the fervent desire to live awakened its latent ability to harness the wind, and thus did it soar to safety. This may or may not have happened, but let's say it did.<tab>You've never <var 1A 02 /var>seen<var 1A 01 /var> a dhalmel before!? - Atelloune

Позовите своего каракуля.<tab>Хотя каракули обычно имеют чёрное руно, это существо, выращенное в загонах Дома Айенарт, родилось снежно-белым. Это редчайшее качество избавило его от участи за обеденным столом, и он вырос до таких размеров, что мог нести людей на своей пушистой спине.<tab>Мудрый рыцарь охраняет свой источник шерсти. —Яэль

Summon forth your ufiti. May carry you to high ground for your own safety.<tab>Having survived a cull of its kind by bloodthirsty adventurers on its native Diadem, this ufiti mastered the art of riding the winds, that it might set forth on a journey to find a worthy leader. Despite its brawn, it possesses a surprisingly delicate touch─and just as well it does.<tab>The strong are drawn to strength. - Ywain

Summon forth your deinonychus. Cleverer than the average prehistoric carnivore.<tab>Native to the southern regions of Ilsabard, the deinonychus is cousin to the raptors that inhabit the Twelveswood. Possessed of superior intelligence, as seen in its habit of hunting in pairs, the beasts have been employed in warfare since antiquity.<tab>Clever girl... - Hunter-turned-prey

Summon forth your Construct 14. Will dispose of friend and foe alike if so commanded, so be careful what you wish for.<tab>During their excavation in the Clockwork City of Goug, the IVth Imperial Legion discovered a host of worker automata, which they repurposed for war. As the name suggests, this particular construct is the fourteenth to undergo such a transformation.<tab>Were you able to find any machina worthy of sssalvaging? - Eshana

Summon forth your kingly peacock, an avian embodiment of nobility hailing from Othard.<tab>From the Near East to the Far, the peacock has long been esteemed not only for its beauty, but also its penchant for eating harmful vilekin. This particular creature belongs to a breed created by improving a species indigenous to Othard with geomancy.<tab>Don't you be taken in by his peacockin'. - Rowena

Summon forth the Great Vessel of Ronka. Don't mind the contents.<tab>This ancient Ronkan urn was discovered empty save for a peculiar flute, the sound of which caused the vessel to suddenly become thus occupied. “Where did it come from?” the curious may be compelled to inquire, but the wise know better than to question the divine.<tab>The great serpent has spoken! - Quinfort

Summon forth your pteranodon, a winged scalekin that has existed since ancient times.<tab>In the course of feeding upon food scraps discarded at the <var 1A 02 /var>Bounty<var 1A 01 /var>, this creature grew so familiar with men as to allow riders upon its back. This goes to show that the way to a prehistoric creature's heart is through its stomach.<tab>With what powerful magicks did they tame this dread fiend? - Nashu Mhakaracca

Summon forth your ruby gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.<tab>Believed to have been absorbed into the Ruby Weapon, this plate-clad being answers the call of a horn imbued with the power of an unknown primal. How the secrets of the horn came to be passed on to its summoner remains a mystery.<tab>A jeweler's daughter must be refined─<var 1A 02 /var>resplendent<var 1A 01 /var>. A ruby amongst the riffraff. - Babawai

Summon forth your hybodus to ride the winds and menace the skies.<tab>A close relative of the tornado shark, this fearsome fish soars the skies by means of an organ that allows it to manipulate wind-aspected aether. The four fins protruding from its head are used to deftly control its course in flight.<tab>What will the morrow bring? Sharks spilling from the sky in a spectacular shower of scales? - Sisipu

Summon forth Ramuh. No, not that one. The one you fought in the Empty. But not the actual one.<tab>It is believed that Shiva's summoning in the Empty caused lightning-aspected aether left over from your battle with Ramuh to coalesce. The resultant crystal, when imbued with magic, gives rise to an entity which assumes the form of the Lord of Levin in all of his horse-legged, hulking glory.<tab>Now nature sends thunder and lightning against us! - Sylphie

Summon forth your Rubellite Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of rubellite geometry.<tab>Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large rubellite, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima.<tab>Betrayed by my own carbuncle yet again... - Tataru

Summon forth your chocobo carriage to ferry your friends around in comfort.<tab>A ubiquitous mode of transportation in Eorzea, the chocobo carriage is kept aloft by ceruleum gas-filled bladders. This technology traces its origins to an early Ixali dirigible that crashed in the Twelveswood and was seized by Gridanian authorities.<tab>We get to ride a horsebird carriage? I don't know... It sounds scary. - Doman Child

Summon forth your Rolling Tankard, a mighty warmachina built by the blacksmiths of Watts's Anvil.<tab>Based on a concept by the legendary Watts, this dwarven warmachina is propelled by a nine-cylinder radial ethanol engine. Its turret-mounted crystal cannon makes short work of sin eaters, while its arms can perform essential motions such as upending tankards.<tab>The Rollin' Tankards, at your service! - Ronitt

Summon forth your Gabriel α. Magic shield not included. Armaments for decorative purposes only.<tab>Prior to building a full-sized prototype of a new transforming armor dubbed <var 1A 02 /var>Gabriel<var 1A 01 /var>, project engineers created this scale test model to perform aerodynamic testing. While it passed said tests with flying colors, it was observed that its engine may be prone to running hot.<tab>It would seem there is more to you than meets the eye. - Yugiri

Summon forth your megalotragus, a herbivore so intimidating it puts carnivores to shame.<tab>Preferring colder climes, this imposing herbivore left its original habitat in Abalathia's Spine and migrated to Coerthas, which had frozen over in the Calamity's wake. Its kind are a primitive species that has largely remained unchanged over time, with some known to awaken to magical powers.<tab>If you squint just the right way, it looks like it's got ears! Or is it horns...? - Nashu Mhakaracca

Summon forth your gwiber of light, a draconic arcane entity.<tab>This light-bathed being answers to the sound of a horn imbued with the power of a hero of eld. In another time and place, perhaps it was the mount of a valiant soul who rose up against evil. Or perhaps not. The truth lies amidst the blinding light.<tab>Such radiance, such magnificence. - The Wandering Minstrel

Призовите кресло-Джибаньян. Таинственный предмет мебели, созданный по образу и подобию йо-кая по имени Джибаньян.<tab>Несмотря на то, что эта таинственная вещь создана по образу йо-кая живущего на земле, это кресло способно летать! Говорят, что оно настолько удобно, что превращает и людей, и йо-каев в никчёмных бездельников.<tab>Присажи-нья-вайтесь!

Call into battle your magitek hyperconveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics.<tab>Guided as ever by the ethos of constant advancement, imperial magitek engineers returned to improve their conveyor system, simplifying its assembly and trimming weight by 8%. The result is enhanced fuel efficiency, demonstrating that even world-conquering empires can be environmentally minded.<tab>Hah! Success! - Aulus mal Asina

Summon forth Ehll Tou, the young dragon with a passion for crafting.<tab>First encountered as a curious dragonet, Ehll Tou became a dragon grown during her stay in Ishgard. With her passion for crafting, she underwent an evolution heretofore unseen in her kind, developing dextrous forelimbs that allow her to deftly wield all manner of implements.<tab>You have a knack for this, Ehll Tou! - Hautdilong

Summon forth Incitatus, an enchanted steed favored of the merchant Rowena. If it could talk, it would doubtless drive a hard bargain.<tab>Under the patronage of its mistress, Rowena, this enchanted steed has led a pampered life. Able to comprehend language, it was often seen attending Khloe Aliapoh's storytelling sessions, her tales of high adventure inspiring it to set out on one of its own.<tab>Your loyal steed awaits! - Voyce
